meanings.definition: To mix or stir quickly and roughly
meanings.sent1: She scrambles the eggs in the pan for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The chef scrambles the ingredients in the wok to make a stir-fry.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled as they tried to scramble the puzzle pieces together.
meanings.sent4: Time scrambles memories in our minds, mixing them up like a jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The wind scrambles the fallen leaves, creating a colorful mess on the ground.

meanings.definition: To move hurriedly or in a disorderly manner
meanings.sent1: The squirrel scrambles up the tree to escape the chasing cat.
meanings.sent2: During the fire drill, students scramble out of the building in a rush.
meanings.sent3: In the race, the competitors scramble to reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent4: The thoughts in my mind scramble when I try to focus on too many things at once.
meanings.sent5: The ants scramble in all directions when their nest is disturbed, trying to protect their queen.

meanings.definition: A dish made by mixing ingredients together and cooking them quickly
meanings.sent1: For brunch, she ordered a delicious plate of scrambled eggs.
meanings.sent2: The diner's special includes toast, bacon, and a side of scrambles.
meanings.sent3: At the potluck, everyone brought a different type of scramble to share.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the breakfast scramble filled the kitchen, making everyone hungry.
meanings.sent5: The chef's signature dish is a breakfast scramble with a secret blend of spices.
